title: Bars We've Been To
name: Bars We've Been To
description:
A Map by Cstoneno37

Bars we've found near Rockville that we have been to.

properties.name: Bar Louie
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37 701 7th St. NW, Washington, DCChain bar convenient to Gallery Place Metro and Verizon Center. It has lots of TVs and a pretty cool atmosphere for a chain bar. They play good music but it\'s not so loud you can\'t talk, and there\'s a large drink menu.

properties.name: Buffalo Billiards
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37 1330 19th St NWChain bar is the only place we\'ve found to play shuffleboard in the area. There\'s also pool. The waitstaff is friendly and the atmosphere is fun.

properties.name: Buffalo Wings and Beer
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37 5240 Randolph Road, Rockville, MD 20852Small strip mall bar with a couple pool tables and a few foosball tables. The beer was kind of stale and the whole place smelled kinda weird but the wings were good.

properties.name: Caddie's on Cordell
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37 4922 Cordell Ave Bethesda, MD 20810Decent bar with lots of TVs and good food, but it\'s on the expensive side and the bar itself is pretty overrated by the people who swear by it.

properties.name: Cafe Citron
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37   1343 Connecticut Ave NWLatin music is absolutely blasting and the place is jam packed with sleazy guys looking to rub up on any girl they can get within dry humping distance of. After waiting in the long line to get in and then fighting through the crowd to get to the bar, drinks are served in plastic cups that should be attached to the office water cooler.

properties.name: Circa
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37 1601 Connecticut Avenue, NWClassy place that deals mostly in wine. The food is good and the wait staff is friendly, but it is on the expensive side.

properties.name: Cleveland Park Bar and Grill
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37  3421 Connecticut Ave NW, Washington, DC 20008Laid back sports bar with a cool atmosphere and pretty good food. Very convenient to the Cleveland Park Metro.

properties.name: Kramerbooks & Afterwords
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno371517 Connecticut Ave. NW, Washington, DCKind of a cool little bar with lots of microbrews but they don\'t come cheap, even at happy hour prices. The service is good but the place gets a little cramped if you\'ve got more than two people in your group because the tables are tiny.

properties.name: Ri Ra
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno374931 Elm St, Bethesda, MDNot a favorite.

properties.name: The Barking Dog
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno37  4723 Elm St., 20814Classy place that deals mostly in wine. The food is good and the wait staff is friendly, but it is on the expensive side.

properties.name: The Brickskeller
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno371523 22nd St NW Lots of beers if you don\'t mind lukewarm bottles... It\'s got kind of a dive feel but the rows of crowded tables are packed and there\'s usually a long line waiting to get in. The service is surly. It\'s barely worth the walk from the Metro. It\'s definitely not worth the wait.

properties.name: The Front Page
properties.description: Posted by Cstoneno371333 New Hampshire Ave NW, Washington, DC 20036A bunch of yuppies and preppy people who all think they\'re too cool. It\'s crowded and really loud during happy hour. It\'s worth going for half price appetizers but the bar itself is nothing to write home about.
